meanings.definition: A person who is learning a trade from a skilled employer, having agreed to work for a fixed period at low wages.
meanings.sent1: The prentice eagerly watched the master craftsman at work.
meanings.sent2: The young prentice showed dedication to learning the trade.
meanings.sent3: The prentice accidentally spilled paint on the masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: Like a prentice to a mentor, the student absorbed every lesson.
meanings.sent5: The prentice's hands-on training made the learning process engaging.

meanings.sent1: The experienced blacksmith decided to prentice his nephew in metalworking.
meanings.sent2: She hoped to prentice talented individuals in the art of pottery.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly threatened to prentice his friend in the art of baking.
meanings.sent4: The wise old carpenter would prentice only those with a true passion for woodworking.
meanings.sent5: The master chef agreed to prentice the aspiring cook in the kitchen.

meanings.definition: To be or work as an apprentice.
meanings.sent1: She chose to prentice under the renowned artist to improve her skills.
meanings.sent2: He decided to prentice at the local garage to learn about car repairs.
meanings.sent3: The young musician was excited to prentice with the famous composer.
meanings.sent4: In the world of magic, one must prentice under a skilled sorcerer to master the craft.
meanings.sent5: To prentice effectively, one must be willing to learn and practice diligently.
